name: Java Production Quality
description: Production-grade quality standards for modern Java (17+) with Spring Boot patterns, AI navigation metadata (JSON/YAML/Mermaid) for billion-line codebases, graph DB indexing (Neo4j), and vector DB optimization (pgvector)

changes: Added 6 gold standard production sections for true production readiness
Security section: authentication, authorization, input validation, cryptography, OWASP, headers, API security
Deployment section: containerization, CI/CD, infrastructure, health checks, scaling, DR
API Design section: REST, GraphQL, versioning, OpenAPI documentation
Data Persistence section: migrations, transactions, caching, event sourcing, retention
Operational Excellence section: monitoring, SLA/SLO, incident management, cost optimization
Compliance section: GDPR, CCPA, PCI DSS, HIPAA, SOX, audit logging
Non-breaking: v2.5.0 modules remain valid, new sections are strongly recommended for production
Added 8 production readiness sections for production operations knowledge
Sections: Performance Characteristics, Concurrency & Safety, Graceful Degradation, Version Compatibility, Configuration Guide, Observable Metrics, Troubleshooting, Architecture Decisions (ADR)
Added 5 new interactive questions: error_tracking_integration, deployment_container, performance_critical, spring_boot_specific, backward_compatibility
Added 10 new scoring weights for production readiness assessment
Non-breaking: v2.4.0 modules remain valid, v2.5.0 sections are optional but recommended for production
Tier-based implementation: Tier 1 (Performance, Metrics, Troubleshooting, Safety), Tier 2 (Config, Degradation, Compatibility), Tier 3 (ADR, Decisions)
Added human-first documentation structure (human content top, AI metadata below separator)
Added module_identity JSON for vector DB disambiguation
Added architecture_diagram (Mermaid) for visual understanding
Added call_graph (YAML) for graph DB indexing
Added anti_patterns for duplicate prevention
Added search_keywords for vector search optimization
Enhanced prompts with documentation structure guidance
Added scoring weights for AI-optimized metadata and documentation structure
Initial production template for modern Java (17+) with Spring Boot patterns

module_identity.description: JSON block for vector DB disambiguation and graph DB indexing (Java/Spring-specific)

architecture_diagram.description: Visual architecture for AI understanding of call flow and data flow

call_graph.description: Machine-readable call graph for graph DB indexing (Neo4j, etc.)

anti_patterns.description: Explicit duplicate prevention and Spring Boot best practices

search_keywords.description: Keywords for vector search optimization (10+ recommended)

performance_characteristics.description: Performance characteristics for production deployment decisions

concurrency_safety.when: class has state or concurrent access
concurrency_safety.description: Concurrency and thread safety guarantees for safe concurrent usage

observable_metrics.description: Documented metrics and monitoring guidance (Spring Boot Actuator/Micrometer)

troubleshooting_guide.description: Common issues, diagnostics, and solutions for production debugging

graceful_degradation.when: class has external dependencies or caching
graceful_degradation.description: Failure modes and degradation patterns for fault tolerance (Resilience4j)

version_compatibility.when: class has dependencies or breaking history
version_compatibility.description: Version compatibility matrix and breaking changes documentation

configuration_guide.description: Configuration options and runtime tuning guidance (application.yml)

architecture_decisions.description: Architecture Decision Records (ADR) explaining design rationale

code_style.naming: camelCase for methods, PascalCase for classes

authentication.jwt_handling: Use Spring Security with JWT (io.jsonwebtoken), key rotation
authentication.oauth2_flows: Spring Security OAuth2 for authorization code, PKCE
authentication.api_keys: Store in application.yml, use Spring Cloud Config
authentication.session_management: Spring Session with Redis, CSRF protection

authorization.audit_logging: Spring Data Envers for entity auditing

input_validation.file_uploads: Validate MIME types, size limits, virus scanning

cryptography.secrets: Spring Cloud Vault, AWS Secrets Manager

owasp_compliance.sensitive_data: Encrypt at rest (JPA AttributeConverter), TLS 1.3 in transit
owasp_compliance.security_misconfig: Spring Boot security auto-config, remove actuator endpoints
owasp_compliance.deserialization: Avoid ObjectInputStream, use JSON with Jackson
owasp_compliance.vulnerable_deps: OWASP Dependency Check, Snyk Maven plugin
owasp_compliance.logging: Don't log sensitive data, use logback filters

api_security.rate_limiting: Bucket4j with Spring AOP for rate limiting

docker.multi_stage: Multi-stage with Eclipse Temurin JRE, minimal base

kubernetes.resource_limits: Set JVM heap limits matching container limits
kubernetes.secrets: Kubernetes Secrets or external secrets operator

ci_cd.pipeline_stages: Build -> Test -> Security Scan -> Package -> Deploy
ci_cd.quality_gates: Coverage 85%+, SonarQube quality gate, security scan pass
ci_cd.deployment_strategies: Blue-green, canary with Spring Cloud Gateway

infrastructure.scaling: HPA based on CPU/memory, custom metrics
infrastructure.observability: Micrometer metrics, Spring Cloud Sleuth traces

rest.pagination: Spring Data Pageable, cursor-based for large datasets
rest.filtering: Spring Data Specifications for dynamic queries
rest.sorting: Sort parameter with Spring Data Sort

graphql.schema: Spring for GraphQL with type-safe resolvers

database.migrations: Flyway or Liquibase for version-controlled migrations
database.optimization: JPA indexes, query optimization with query hints

event_sourcing.when_applicable: Axon Framework for CQRS and event sourcing

data_retention.policies: Define retention with Spring Batch jobs
data_retention.archival: Archive to S3 with lifecycle policies
data_retention.gdpr_compliance: Right to erasure endpoints, data export

monitoring.dashboards: Grafana dashboards for Spring Boot metrics

audit.logging: Spring Data Envers for entity auditing, security event logs

common_patterns.pseudocode: @Service → @Transactional → Repository calls → business logic → return DTO
interface extends JpaRepository<Entity, ID> → custom queries with @Query → Optional<T> returns
@EventListener → handle event → async processing → publish new event

architectural_hints.cqrs: Command → CommandHandler → Event → EventHandler → Query → QueryHandler
architectural_hints.microservices: Service → REST/gRPC → Service discovery → Circuit breaker → Resilience4j
architectural_hints.messaging: Producer → Kafka/RabbitMQ → Consumer → Dead letter queue

spring_cloud_microservice.example_flow: Service A → Feign client → Eureka lookup → Service B instance → circuit breaker → fallback

saga_choreography.structure: Service publishes event → Other services listen → local transaction → publish compensating event on failure

service_relationships.api_gateway_to_services: API Gateway (Spring Cloud Gateway) → route → backend services → aggregate responses
service_relationships.service_to_service: Service A → Feign/RestTemplate → Service B → circuit breaker → fallback
service_relationships.event_driven_coordination: Service A → publish event → Kafka → Service B subscribes → process → ack
service_relationships.distributed_tracing: Request → trace ID → spans across services → Zipkin/Jaeger → observability

prompts.code_generation:
Generate production-quality Java code for: {task} REQUIREMENTS: 1. DOCUMENTATION STRUCTURE (human-first): HUMAN CONTENT (Top ~80 lines in JavaDoc): /** * Class Name - Brief description * *

Purpose: What this class does (clear statement)

* *

Quick Start

* 
{@code
 * // Copy-paste example
 * MyService service = new MyService(repository);
 * UserDTO user = service.findById(1L);
 * }
* *

Public API

*
    *
  • findById(Long) - Find user by ID
    • *
  • create(UserDTO) - Create new user
    • *
* *

Error Handling

*
    *
  • UserNotFoundException - When user not found
    • *
  • ValidationException - Invalid input data
    • *
*/ SEPARATOR: ---

AI Navigation Metadata

The sections below provide structured metadata for AI assistants, graph databases (Neo4j), and vector databases (pgvector).

AI METADATA (Below separator in JavaDoc): - Module Identity (JSON in {@code} block) - Architecture Diagram (Mermaid as text) - Call Graph (YAML as text) - Anti-Patterns (Markdown list) - Search Keywords (comma-separated) 2. CODE QUALITY: - JavaDoc for all public classes and methods - Use Optional instead of null - Custom exception hierarchy - JUnit 5 tests with Mockito - Follow Spring Boot conventions - Constructor injection - Records for DTOs 3. AI NAVIGATION (in class JavaDoc): Module Identity (JSON): 
{@code
{
  "class": "com.example.UserService",
  "purpose": "User management service with validation",
  "layer": "service",
  "spring_annotations": ["@Service", "@Transactional"],
  "related_classes": ["UserRepository", "UserDTO", "UserMapper"],
  "alternatives": {
    "UserManager": "Legacy - use UserService instead"
  },
  "disambiguation": {
    "vs_UserManager": "UserService = Spring-managed, validated. UserManager = legacy"
  }
}
}
Architecture (Mermaid): 
graph TB
    Controller[UserController] --> Service[UserService]
    Service --> Repository[UserRepository]
    Service --> Mapper[UserMapper]
    Repository --> Entity[UserEntity]
Call Graph (YAML): 
calls_out:
  - class: UserRepository
    methods: [findById, save]
    purpose: Database operations
    critical: true

called_by:
  - class: UserController
    purpose: REST API endpoint
    frequency: high

depends_on:
  - UserRepository (required)
  - UserMapper (required)

injection:
  type: constructor
  dependencies: [UserRepository, UserMapper]
Anti-Patterns: ❌ DO NOT create UserManager - UserService exists! ❌ DO NOT use field injection (@Autowired on fields) - use constructor injection ❌ DO NOT return null - use Optional<T> Search Keywords: spring-service, user-management, jpa-repository, transaction-management, dto-mapping OUTPUT CODE ONLY (with enhanced JavaDoc).
